From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: farmer

English

[edit]
English Wikipedia has an article on:
Farmer
Wikipedia

Proper noun

[edit]

Farmer (countable and uncountable, plural Farmers)

  1. A surname.
    • 2019 December 22, Annalee Newitz and Cyrus Farivar, “Nick Farmer knows dozens of languages, so he invented one for The Expanse”, in Ars Technica‎[1]:
      It all started when Nick Farmer bought George R. R. Martin a drink, but the plot really thickened when the linguist met Martin’s then-assistant Ty Franck.
  2. (NATO code name) the Soviet MiG 19 aircraft.
  3. A placename in the United States:
    1. A township in Rice County, Kansas.
    2. An unincorporated community in Pike County, Missouri.
    3. An unincorporated community in Randolph County, North Carolina.
    4. A township and unincorporated community therein, in Defiance County, Ohio.
    5. A small town in Hanson County, South Dakota.

Translations

[edit]
Equivalent surnames of "farmer" in other languages
  • Arabic: فلاح (fallāḥ)
  • Czech: Sedlák
  • Dutch: Boer (nl)
  • German: Bauer (de)
  • Italian: Campagnaro
  • Latvian: Arājs
  • Lithuanian: Rolnikas
  • Low German:
    German Low German: Buhr
  • Polish: Rolnik
  • Russian: Плужников (ru) (Plužnikov)
  • Slovak: Kmeť
  • Ukrainian: Плужник (uk) (Plužnyk)

Anagrams

[edit]
  • framer

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

(This etymology is missing or incomplete. Please add to it, or discuss it at the Etymology scriptorium.)

Proper noun

[edit]

Farmer ?

  1. a surname

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Either directly borrowed from English farmer or formed in German as Farm +‎ -er.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [ˈfaʁmɐ]
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

Noun

[edit]

Farmer m (strong, genitive Farmers, plural Farmer, feminine Farmerin)

  1. farmer (male or of unspecified gender) (especially in reference to English-speaking countries)
    Synonyms: Bauer, Landwirt

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Farmer [masculine, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein der Farmer die Farmer
genitive eines des Farmers der Farmer
dative einem dem Farmer den Farmern
accusative einen den Farmer die Farmer

Synonyms

[edit]
  • Bauersmann (cf. Bauersfrau, Bauersleute)

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Farmersalat
  • Farmersfrau

Further reading

[edit]

  • “Farmer” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache
